data.title: Cher height, son, daughter, ethnicity, where is she now, dead or alive?
data.meta_description: Cher is a singer and actress from America. She has had a long and unique career that has led to her being affectionately dubbed the goddess of pop. She
data.text:
Cher is a singer and actress from America. She has had a long and unique career that has led to her being affectionately dubbed the goddess of pop. She flew high in the American entertainment industry when she was basically male dominated. She has a unique contralto voice that makes her stand out from the crowd by singing and even speaking. Cher has had her fair share of dominance in the entertainment industry and has a style that has supported her career for nearly six decades.

Cher’s Bio (Ethnicity)

Cher’s full name at birth was Cherilyn Sarkisian, and she was born on May 20, 1946 in ElCentro, California to an Armenian-American truck driver with drug and gambling problems and an Irish, German, English and Cherokee mother who was an occasional model and actress was.

As Cher grew up, she and her family had little, since her mother eventually had to leave her in an orphanage, so she visited her every day. Her fascination with entertainment started early. In fifth grade, she produced the musical Oklahoma! for her class; Organization of a group of girls andteaching and instructing them to act and dance. When she could not persuade boys to participate, she took over the male roles and sang her songs. She had developed a deep voice by the age of nine and took Audrey Hepburn as her role model. She began dressing and acting like the character the actress portrayed in 1961’s Breakfast at Tiffany’s.

Cher attended a private school in Encino called Montclair College Preparatory School, but dropped out at age 16 as she just wanted to be famous and stand out from most of her friends and peers. She left home and moved to Los Angeles with a friend. There she took acting classes and danced in a few clubs along the Hollywood Sunset Strip. She never hesitated to introduce herself to people in the store she wanted to go to; the business of entertaining people. This is how Cher met performer Sonny Bono, who later became her husband. Bono was working with record producer Phil Spector at the time, and Cher began working as his housekeeper. He in turn introduced her to Phil Spector, who then allowed her to

Cher and Sonny began dating and soon after unofficially wed on October 27, 1964, Cher’s star began to shine in 1965 as part of the folk-rock duo with her husband Sonny. They called themselves Sonny & Cher and that year their song I got you, baby reached number one on both the American and British charts. By the end of 1967 they had sold 40 million records worldwide. In 1966, Cher also launched her own solo career and had her first million-selling hit, Bang Bang (My Baby Shot Me) .
